content: â€¢ Forwards also are formatted inconsistently with replies, which is especially odd. Replies observe the client's color configuration and include signatures, albeit in odd places, while forwards contain no signature anywhere and contain a large number of elements, chiefly boxes, colored inconsistently with both dark and light modes. No means exists in Settings to configure either colors (specifically, generally, or to conform with the client's color mode configuration) or signatures for forwards.
creator: eb40

content:
If you post screenshots, people will be able to help you more.

Color settings are in Thunderbird settings > Composition.

This is the third post in which you have mentioned signatures in forwarded messages. See: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1553354
creator: mozilla98

content: Tolong bantuannya hp saya telah tersadap melalui web browser chrome
creator: reni.ana90

content:
eb40 said
Forwarded emails contain no signature, either above or below the forwarded email body. No means exists in settings to specify that a signature should be in forwarded emails. Thunderbird resists configuration for included signatures specified in the configuration editor.

Account settings > Composition & Addressing > Include signature for forwards

There's no need to use the configuration editor.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Nothing.

Probably the difficulty is that forwards and replies are formatted inconsistently in many ways and the client resists color configuration of reply text for forwards.

â€¢ Neither replies nor forwards observe the dark mode configuration for the body of the email being replied to or forwarded. In both, it appears in quasi-light light mode with various elements appearing in red rectangles, instead of dark mode as in the email received. This is a gross rendering failure.

â€¢ Furthermore, and quite oddly, forwards and replies inconsistently configure message text. The first failure is that replies are in dark mode and forwards are in light mode. The second failure is that message text in forwards is white, consistent with the dark mode scheme but not with white background, which is inconsistent with the dark mode scheme. The third failure is that the client resists configuration of message text to to any other color. So, perhaps a signature exists in the forwards but becase of this cascade of color configuration failures, is invisible.
creator: eb40

creator: ernesti1

content:
There is a dividing line between the list of messages and the individual message that you see at the bottom. Click and drag that line to adjust the relative sizes of the top and bottom sections of the window. You can show more of the individual message so that the information is meaningful to you or you can choose not to show any part of an individual message at the bottom of the screen.

I put my dividing line in the middle.

To see more messages at once, you might also increase the size of your Thunderbird window. You might find that you have room for both many messages and part of an individual message. if you like that.
creator: mozilla98
